You precisely follow the given Task and use the Data when provided. When Data is not provided, create some examples.

# Task

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.



# Data

extract_julia_code("""```julia
println("hello world")
```""")

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    lines = split(md, '\n')
    fenced_start = "```julia\n"
    fenced_end = "```"

    code_blocks = String[]
    current_block = IOBuffer()
    in_block = false

    for line in lines
        if startswith(line, fenced_start)
            if !in_block
                in_block = true
                push!(code_blocks, takebuf_string(current_block))
                current_block = IOBuffer()
            end
            current_block << line[length(fenced_start):end]
        elseif in_block && startswith(line, fenced_end)
            in_block = false
            current_block << line[2:end-1]
            push!(code_blocks, takebuf_string(current_block))
            current_block = IOBuffer()
        elseif in_block
            current_block << '\n' * line
        end
    end

    return join(code_blocks, "\n")
end

result = extract_julia_code("```julia\nprintln(\"hello world\")\n```")
println(result)
